required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study of the Safety and Performance of the Miami InnFocus Drainage Implant to Relieve Glaucoma Symptoms
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study of the Safety and Performance of the Miami InnFocus Drainage Implant to Relieve Glaucoma Symptoms

brief_summary.textblock: Assess the safety and performance of the Miami InnFocus Drainage Implant in patients suffering from glaucoma that is inadequately controlled on tolerated medical therapy with intraocular pressure greater than or equal to 18 mm Hg and less than or equal to 40 mm Hg.

detailed_description.textblock: Unicentric, non-randomized, single arm safety and performance study which will be conducted in accordance with the applicable parts of CFR 21 and Standard EN-ISO 14155 I & II: 2003 on clinical investigations with medical devices on human subjects and recommendations guiding physicians in biomedical research involving human subjects adopted by the 18th World Medical Assembly, Helsinki, Finland, 1964 and later revisions

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Performance Success
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 7, Week 3, Week 6, Month 3, Month 9, Month 12, Month 24, Month 36, Month 48 and Month 60
primary_outcome.description: Success: IOP < 15 mmHg or IOP reduced from baseline (pre-operative level) by ≥ 20% (without glaucoma reoperation, such as a trabeculectomy to improve aqueous drainage or implantation of another drainage implant).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 7, Week 3, Week 6, Month 3, Month 9, Month 12, Month 24, Month 36, Month 48 and Month 60
secondary_outcome.description: Maintenance of pressure control throughout the follow-up period, as measured by IOP at each post-operative visit

other_outcome.description: Defined by ease of insertion of the device into the anterior chamber, based on an Investigator evaluation rating (5-point scale, with 1 being difficult and 5 being easy);

other_outcome.measure: Time (in Minutes) Taken for the Procedure
other_outcome.description: The mean surgical procedure time from the time the incision was made in the conjunctiva to the time peritomy closure

other_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 7, Week 3, Week 6, Month 3, Month 9, Month 12, Month 24, Month 36, Month 48 and Month 60
other_outcome.description: Visual acuity measured at each post-operative visit from baseline.
Visual field measure at each post op visit. Data not available for summary as per CSR

other_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 thru Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12, Month 24, Month 36, Month 48 and Month 60
other_outcome.description: The number of glaucoma supplemental medications required after the MicroShunt procedure.
Incidence of implant migration. None reported
Incidence of implant encapsulation. None reported

arm_group.description: Ab externo glaucoma drainage device with no reservoir

intervention.description: Insertion of MIDI Arrow subconjunctivally with a fornix-based incision after pretreatment of scleral surface with 0.4 mg/mL MMC and insertion of MIDI Arrow tube through sclera into anterior chamber of eye

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female, age 18 to 85 years, inclusive
- Glaucoma that is inadequately controlled on tolerated medical therapy with intraocular pressure greater than or equal to 18 mm Hg and less than or equal to 40 mm Hg.
- Patient must have signed informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unwilling or unable to give informed consent or unable to return for scheduled protocol visits
- Pregnant or nursing women
- No light perception
- Active iris neovascularization or active proliferative retinopathy
- Iridocorneal endothelial syndrome
- Epithelial or fibrous downgrowth
- Aphakia (without pseudophakia)
- Vitreous in anterior chamber for which a vitrectomy is anticipated
- Chronic or recurrent uveitis
- Severe posterior blepharitis
- Unwilling to discontinue contact lens use after surgery
- Previous ophthalmic surgery, excluding uncomplicated phacoemulsification (cataract) surgery or corneal refractive surgery
- Need for glaucoma surgery combined with other ocular procedures other than cataract surgery (i.e., penetrating keratoplasty or retinal surgery) or anticipated need for additional ocular surgery
- Known allergy to Mitomycin C (MMC) drug.

overall_official.affiliation: Laser Center, Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This report presents data for 23 patients (Patients 13 to 35), who were implanted with the MicroShunt (one eye implanted per patient)

group.title: MIDI Arrow
group.description: Eligible patients with POAG were implanted with a MicroShunt in the anterior chamber of the eye

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
